stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

preGame:
## üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM FLETCHINGS FIELD!

Good evening, blood sports fans, and welcome to another brutal Tuesday Night Trollball broadcast! This is Nok the Corrupter, your voice of violence, coming to you live from the leafy, shifting grounds of Fletchings Field! The air is crisp, the ground is uneven, and the local druids have set up some truly nasty tripping hazards for our entertainment tonight! It‚Äôs a beautiful night for a beatdown!

Tonight, we have a matchup that smells like self-righteousness and sap! Visiting us are the **Haven Lights**, a team so full of piety it makes me want to vomit up my own horns! They‚Äôre currently sitting at 0-0, just like their opponents, but don‚Äôt let that fool you‚Äîthey‚Äôre itching to spread their "light" all over the pitch. I was watching their warmups, and frankly, it‚Äôs embarrassing. Tybi Reo is over on the sideline drawing a diagram of a Troll head that looks more like a potato with a severe allergy! If that‚Äôs their tactical mastermind, we‚Äôre in for a comedy of errors!

Facing them is the home team, **Oak & Onslaught**! Representing the Wardens, these folks usually love trees more than winning, but tonight they look ready to rumble. I spotted Wynnie Faina warming up, and folks, I‚Äôm delighted to report he has put his boots on the wrong feet! Is it a superstition? Is it a tactical handicap? Or is he just hoping to snap his own ankles so he doesn't have to listen to Sir Randy prattle on about archery? Either way, I love the commitment to pain!

So grab your popcorn, ignore your healers, and pray for fractures! The referee is checking the ball‚Äîit looks angry‚Äîand we are moments away from carnage! LET'S PLAY TROLLBALL!
postGame:
## üí• POST-GAME REPORT: LIGHTS OUT FOR OAK!

Well, folks, put a cork in the bottle and wipe the blood off the seats, because this one is in the history books! The final whistle has blown at Fletchings Field, and unfortunately, the forces of unbearable brightness have prevailed. **The Haven Lights take it down with a final score of 4 to 2 over Oak & Onslaught.** It disgusts me to say it, but the Lights flickered to life just enough to steal the win.

The game started with the coordination of a headless chicken convention. We saw dropped passes, missed tackles, and wild shots flying everywhere! Zwart Bunns tried to shoot early for Haven but couldn't hit the broad side of a barn, and Ema Ulrick returned the favor for Oak by launching the ball into the stratosphere. It was looking like a scoreless bore until the violence finally kicked in!

And oh, did it kick in! Affra Yanaton, bless their violent heart, decided enough was enough. They lined up Marlane Lounge and delivered a tackle so hard I felt it in my molars! ü¶¥ CRACK! Lounge went down, INJURED, and was dragged off the field. That is the kind of initiative I like to see! If you can't score, just break the opponent's bones!

But, credit where it's due‚Äîeven if I hate giving it‚ÄîMarlane Lounge came back from the dead thanks to Healer Riffle Harrington. And Marlane didn't just come back; they came back angry. Moments after returning, Lounge plowed into Millham Evangeline, sending the Bardiche-wielder straight to the dirt with a nasty injury! Revenge is a dish best served with a side of concussion, folks!

We went into Halftime with a 0-0 deadlock, mostly because nobody could hold onto the slippery leather. I assume the players spent the break crying to their mothers or, in Haven's case, singing campfire songs. Whatever they did, it woke them up for the second half.

Out of the gate, Shiroma Salim finally remembered the point of the game. He launched a shot from Home Field‚Äîa risky move!‚Äîand drilled it right through the goal! **2-0 Haven Lights!** Silence fell over the Warden fans, probably because they were too busy admiring the trees to cheer.

But Oak & Onslaught wasn't done yet! Milt Casady, the man who loves a good chant, picked up the ball in Center Field. He shook off a tackle and fired a rocket to tie the game! **2-2!** We had ourselves a real scrap, folks! The crowd went wild, or at least as wild as people associated with Sir Falric can get without charging a fee.

Then came the late-game butchery! Symer Crissy of Oak & Onslaught absolutely leveled Riffle Heyde, taking them out of the game completely! INJURY! And moments later, Normi Glaudia smashed Farand Keil into the turf! Another INJURY! Oak was winning the physical war, racking up the body count like true champions of chaos!

However, tragedy struck for the home team. Despite the pile of broken Haven bodies, that pesky Marlane Lounge‚Äîthe one who had already been injured once today!‚Äîfound the ball in their hands again. From Home Field, Lounge launched a Hail Mary shot... and **SCORES! 4-2 Haven!** Unbelievable!

Milt Casady tried desperately to answer back in the dying seconds, but his final shot went wide, much like Sir Randy's fashion sense. The clock hit zero, and the Haven Lights celebrated their unholy victory. A sad day for darkness, but a great day for orthopedic surgeons! Until next week, this is Nok the Corrupter signing off‚Äîremember, if you can't win, make sure the other guy can't walk!
